task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 287°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and ground contact to estimate total height, so I should tilt up while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and upward, but the target building is to the west (~287°), so I should rotate left to face it while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
I’m facing west but need the building at ~287° (slightly north of west), so I should yaw a bit right to align with the facade before estimating height.
I’m currently facing north (17°) and need to face the building at 287°, so I should rotate left to 287°.
To estimate height I need to see the top of the west-facing building, so I should tilt up while staying on this heading.
The camera again jumped to north; I need to face west (270–287) to view the target building, so rotate left to 270 while keeping pitch up.
I need a full view from base to roofline, so I should look slightly down to include the building’s base before estimating height.
The view is again facing north; to assess the west building I must rotate left to 287° while keeping this downward pitch to see the base.
I’m correctly facing the target building at 287°, so I should now provide a height estimate based on its apparent ~3-story scale and typical floor-to-floor heights.
